page.title: 11Kidderminster, Football
page.content: The Kidderminster Harriers Football Club has had its stadium at Aggborough since the late 19th Century. The Club enjoyed its most successful period in the years following the First World War, when the 7th Worcester's side became almost the Harrier's side. Perhaps the most famous Harrier who actually played for the side was Teddy Peers, the Welsh International goalkeeper, who joined the club in 1923. Attached to the ground at Aggborough is the Kidderminster Harriers Social Supporters Club. It resembles a working men's club and has a strong tradition of family attachment.
